review: I won't lie, I dig me some Red Robin!  I have been here many times, it's never so packed you have to wait, but always busy, and i've never had a bad meal, or bad service here. Wow, there was alot of fucking commas in that sentence just now!!  I'm not a huge fan of the fries, which are endless, btw, but i've been here with some guys who were more than happy about bottomless fries!!  They have good apps and salads, and the staff is pretty friendly. I love their burgers, and I've other stuff from the menu and it is all good, all I have tried anyway.  It's not romantic, or frilly, and it's not gonna be the best meal you've had in your life, but it's good solid food, good portions, and good prices..   it's a good go-to place when you're hungry and can't think of anywhere else to go. Yes, that actually does happen to me sometimes, my brain gets over-thunk!!  Crap, I just looked over and seen my review is similar to Nicole T... but we differ on the fries.  LOL!!  They have a full bar too.  So get yer fuckin' drinks on!!  /Standby!!
Consistently decent food. Creative burgers. Just had a Royal Monster. Bottomless fries. Good spot, family friendly.

Had a great time there a few Saturdays ago.  It was around 6 pm so there was a 15 minute wait.  Not bad! I love the fact that you can get other sides besides steak fries with the burgers.  Now I love steak fries - but I will sit there and eat basket after basket of them.  Have to avoid them completely.  I ordered my Garden Burger with a side of Freckled Fruit Salad.  The fruit did not have freckles, but it was extremely tasty.  Service was very good for a Saturday night when they were very busy.  No complaints!

I love me some Red Robin especially the Royal Red Robin Burger which was the first time I ever experienced a fried egg of a burger. It's pretty epic if I may say so. What would make it even better is if the egg was cooked over medium or over easy so you had the creamy runny yolk spill out and mix with the burger. I am guessing if I ask for it made that way they would. I was also surprised at how good the Buzzard (Chicken) Wings were when we first got them and it has become a favorite as a appetizer when we dine there. They are crispier than other Wings I have had, but they are still tender and juicer and the buffalo sauce they use is pretty spot on. Not a fan of the Blue Cheese though so I sub that out for Ranch instead. Service is usually always fast we have never really had any issues with that minus a few instances here and there. Mike #4 (there used to be three others from what he told us) though is the best Server that place has and may be the best Server at any restaurant I have been to. I joke by saying he is better than Mike's 1 through 3 combined, but it is the truth.
Normally I would hate a burger joint chain restaurant... But with black bean and garden burgers, half off appetizers after 8 on weekdays and booze milkshakes. I'm down.

Ok, I know that one-star is harsh because I have had other visits to this location that were fine but this time was REALLY that bad. Obviously, as a son-of-2-foodies, my four year old gets to pick the places to eat for his b-day.  Morning time was pancakes... Part "deux" was Red Robin.  Oh, son, you have much to learn.  None the less, on the way to meet up with my parents here (a whole 1/2 mile from my house) I almost got smacked by a speeding Grandma in a minivan exiting the Macomb mall... that should have been my first clue to stay home. Upon arriving, it's PACKED. There's like 20 (with anxiety AND almost getting hit in the lot it appears and sounds more like 200) children in the lobby of the place and we have to wait for 20 minutes.  The wait isn't really an issue... we should have called ahead.  I think we probably only waited closer to just over 10 minutes anyways.   We are seated and almost immediately Arica comes to take our order.  Well, no, hun... we haven't really even sat down but I'm staring at the drink menu (because speeding granny + loud children =I NEED some alcohol ASAP) and I order the first thing on the page (freckled lemonade).  My dad gets a regular drink, my mom gets a beer, and my son gets a lemonade. So, a little while later and we order our meals (drinks still haven't came because "The bar is really backed up").  My son gets a kid's meal and lets Arica know it's his birthday (HINT HINT - this means we want the annoying song and clapping gig).  My Dad gets some burger and my mom and I get the same burger only she gets hers well-done and I get mine medium-well with no tomato/lettuce.   So finally my mom's beer, and my dad and I's drink come (my kid still has no lemonade).  I'm tasting my drink and I'm like "Yo... either I'm an alkie or there's no liquor in this."  My dad can't taste any either.  We catch Arica going past and ask her about my son's lemonade and I tell her I am not sure I have the right drink since I can't taste alcohol.  She says "I didn't know you wanted the alcoholic one."  Ummm... if I wanted non-alcoholic I would have A.) Said so B.) Not been staring at the drink menu.  So she takes it away (and leaves us wondering why it took so long at the bar to get my mom 1 beer since that was supposedly the hold up).   So... 10 minutes later (no drink in site... not even water) Arica returns and tells me "the strawberries are frozen so I might want to order something else."  I pick out a margarita... thinking you CAN'T fuck this up.   Here comes the food - great.  But wait... I don't have a drink and my son STILL doesn't have his lemonade. (we remind her again) She comes back 5 minutes lter with my original drink (now with vodka). Guess who STILL doesn't have his lemonade?   My burger tastes dry as hell... but at this point I don't care.  Mid-way through I look at it and there isn't an iota of pink in it.  I'm like "Does this look like medium well to you?"... everyone agrees it doesn't.  My mother shows me her almost finished burger and says "This does... I just shut my eyes and didn't think about it."  So she got MY burger with toppings and I got HER dried out ass burger with no tomatoe.  (Thanks Mom.)  I just set it down and didn't bother asking for a bag.  After a third request, Arica FINALLY returned with the lemonade... which was after we were all done eating.   She comes up to me and tells me "I'm bringing the bill but I had to take off that drink you ordered so you don't get charged for it."  Um... duh, don't do me any favors....cuz I certainly wasn't going to pay for it.  We don't even bring up the birthday issue at this point (even though he doesn't understand why everyone else got a song but him as plenty of other birthdays were there)... I tell my son we're going to Coldstone across the street, left her a 10% that she hardly deserved and dipped. I get it when it's slow... it's going to be a wait.  I totally understand that.  The wait was NOT the issue.  The consistent inaccuracy, ignoring a special request, serving the wrong food AND wrong drink AND/OR NO drink, was unacceptable.  Probably the WORST service I've encountered in quite a long time.  I think the only thing they got right was the onion rings. lol I hope that was either an off-day or someone needs to think about a career change.  Hey, I was a sucky waitress a million years ago... but I did everyone a favor and quit. I will probably come back if it's not packed (or go to a different location) if my kid requests it only because it's so close... but I will make sure I have any server besides this one.  I feel badly, because maybe she's a nice person (she gave 100 empty apologies) but this is NOT her calling.

I'm a sucker for a good burger. All of the choices in the world and I had to give Red Robin another shot.  I have always felt this place is way overpriced and a bizarre concept of a full liquor bar and kid friendly atmosphere.   I mean, what could possibly go wrong? So on the menu was the limited edition Oktoberfest Burger and Sam Adams Oktoberfest Beer, so that's exactly the direction I was going.  Good choice!  Good shaved Black Forest Ham, Sauteed Onions, Provolone Cheese and a Dark Brown Mustard on a lovely Pretzel Roll.  So full of flavor, cooked to a turn and there were some home fries involved (pic uploaded).  Burger was great, fries seemed to have sit for a bit, but not bad.  The Sam Adams really pulled it all together. The girl seemed new, really new.  She eventually led me to the best burger on the menu so she is forgiven.  But seriously, the least possible qualification is to know your product. Your saving grace is your great burgers Red Robin, don't screw it up.

I really dislike this place.  I can count on one hand how many times I have been here and each time it has been awful. This week being the holidays, a lot of friends in from out of town looking to get together.  Someone (NOT ME!) threw out the idea of Red Robin, I really just want to see my friends and planned on skipping the meal.  We have a group of 11-12 so we knew calling a day or two in advance would be key.   I called to make the reservation and the girl says "Sorry, we only do call ahead seating." and I tell her "Well it isn't for today, it is for Thursday and we will have about 12 people." "Nope. Sorry."  Why do places do this?  I can understand if I was calling for 4 people.  I was a server for 4 years, if someone called in advance for 12 we would be thrilled!!  We can plan seating and make sure we have enough staff to cover a group of that size without chaos being thrown into the mix!  Well forget you Red Robin, we went some place (Thank goodness) that DOES accept reservations and would like our money.

My husband and I ate here this past Friday evening.  I ordered the patty melt.  It was so greasy!  The fries were hard.  I'm not sure why.  My husband ordered the Whiskey River burger and liked it.  We went thirsty waiting for a refill and then waited a while for our bill.  Next time I'm in the mood for a burger, I'm going to The Sand Bar in Harrison Township.  The burgers are awesome and the martinis are great too!

Ordered the ROYAL REDROBIN w/ONION RING and the WHISKY BBQ CHICKEN SANDWICH. I've been here before but never for a take out. Service could stand some polishing up. Food was, meh. If I was dining in I would've ordered the onionring tower...delish.

Today 10-8-14 was horrible for lunch. Was seated all the way in the back and felt ignored. The table was dirty and the hostess had to bring silverware. The fries were not hot and soggy. Hopefully it was just a bad day for them but I am reluctant to go back any time soon.

My friend and I stopped here for lunch today because it was close and she wanted a burger.  We were seated in a two top table when the place was dead. Seriously my biggest pet peeve at a restaurant.  The menu is pretty extensive but what I noticed was everything was so expensive. I don't mind paying for something when the quality and quantity fits the price.  My $9 burger didn't fit that description.  My burger was dry and flavorless. Bun was had and the bottomless fries were soggy and cold.  The place reminded me of a Burger King except I've had 1) better burgers at BK and 2) the service is better at BK.  Restaurant was very dirty and had stains and stickyness throughout.  There is better burger places closeby.
The burgers were good, the drinks were great! The service was good as well. My little one said this was the best place ever and thats a plus!
Stopped by for a late bite with a few co-workers, the waitress   and the service was great. Grabbed a lettuce wrap burger, with sweet potato fries... Was decent

I honestly really like Red Robin. Its just this location that always gives me hassle. My boyfriend and I fancied a burger. Our server, Shirley, was lovely! I ordered the bailey's milkshake (I love it), and she asks to see my license. I was in the process of getting it renewed, so I have the paper stapled to my license from the secretary of state etch. She says she needs to show it to her manager. She comes back, and says that she can't serve me alcohol, because the manager thinks it doesn't look like a real license. The poor girl is apologizing profusely, my boyfriend and I ask to speak to the manager. He comes over, is rude from the start, and says I'm not being served alcohol. I am low maintenance, and I'm not going to get all emotional because I can't get a drink. I told the manager that its ridiculous, and he obviously thinks I'm a liar. He just walked away. Shirley is so apologetic and embarrassed, but we reassure her its not her fault. She hardly charged us for our meal, and we gave her a 50% tip, and wrote how lovely the service was, but how awful management is.  So, we decide to give the place another try, and I have my new license, and guess what? They're out of bailey's for the milkshake. Our server, Sara, was lovely, which made up for it. My fries came out 15 mins after my entrée, but whatever! They have the best fries! Then, we go back a third time, and ask for Shirley. She's amazing!! I ask for the bailey's milkshake, and they're STILL out of bailey's. Its been 4/5 weeks!! I work in the restaurant industry, and my partner and I always tip at least 30%. The service there has always been wonderful, but the management is an utter joke. Where I work, management are actually competent, and not just standing around doing nothing. My boyfriend and I only go back because of the service, and how close it is to home.

Terrible service and below average food. I have been to many Red Robin restaurants in numerous states and this did not fare well by comparison. Server was clueless and had to be prompted for the most basic items.   Boneless wings were ok but entrees and kid's meal were poor.

We've always loved going to Red Robin.  This location is hit or miss.  We went on a Monday night around 7:00 p.m. My husband and I were with our 2 kids. The parking lot was half full and many booths and tables were open. Perfect right? Well, not for this location. The hostess walked up, said nothing other than "how many" and she asked for our name. I questioned why and she told us we had a 20 minute wait. WHAT!? I asked why the wait, and pointed out several tables that were open and she replied, " our kitchen is busy, so we're giving them a break". So we're supposed to sit by the door (it's freezing outside) and wait till they feel like working, with 2 kids in tow? That's stupid. We left, went across the street and gave our money to another restaurant.  Never again will I give my money to a restaurant that doesn't want us. Be smarter next time.

Very unreliable information provided by the staff. After a long day my girlfriend and I wanted to get a couple of root beer floats to go. When I went in to order them I wasn't sure of the price and when asked this employee said it'll be a few bucks plus tax. Knowing it would be only a few bucks I decided to get two so we wouldn't have to share. When I got the floats and she said it was $9.56 I was baffled. That's approximately 3 dollars more than she said it would be. I should be able to trust the staff and with this incident I don't feel like I can. They do have great food though.

I try not to go here but I had a gift card and I needed to spend it. Every time I come to this hole of a restaurant I have terrible service. My last trip was a couple of days ago and it was a disaster. My beer to 15 minutes and the food came out cold and 2 of my classes had something in it.  I only give this place 2 stars instead of one because their cheese sticks are amazing.

Ordered a double cheeseburger and when the food came back 30 mins later it only had one patty. I asked if it was correct and the waitress said she would ask the cook. The description in the menu I showed her should have been an indicator. She said she would put the order in again. Another 30 mins goes by and they bring me my food and it's still wrong. The cheeseburger was smaller than a McDouble. I'm not the type of person to complain but this was getting ridiculous. Keep in mind that the waitress did not refill our drinks or fries which was all I had eaten at this point. I then asked to see the manager. She was also no help at all. She claimed that was the burger I ordered and said that two Kid patties equalled a 6 oz. regular patty. I asked her then "why was I paying two dollars more for the same amount of meat." She replied with "I don't make the prices, that's corporate." The manager gave me the disappointing burger for free. I just wanted to leave at this point but our waitress was avoiding us like we had Ebola. I went to the front waitstaff table and asked if I could just pay there. I was told the bar could take care of it. I went up to the bar and asked to be checked out. The bartender said that my waitress had to give me the bill and I had to pay through her. He then called for her to give us the bill. She was playing on her phone and looked up and gave the bartender a dirty look. Finally she gave us the bill. I gave her my debit card and she left and came right back with it. Normally I am very generous with the tip. I've been known to tip up to 40%. I couldn't justify giving the waitress a tip after the experience I had. It was difficult for me because at one time I only was paid on tips. I didn't eat the burger after that because by the time I got it it was cold and my fiancé had long been finished with her food. I then drove down to I-696 and Gratiot to Seaburger Cheeseburger and had a great experience. The food there was freshly made and delicious, the gentleman there was very nice as well. Just one of the burgers I got at Seaburger Cheeseburger was the size of what I was given at Red Robin and it's considered a slider. I will never visit this location again and urge everyone else to do the same.

Really good burgers at a good price. A great place for families and groups. Nice waitstaff and I was very impressed by their cleaning regiment. What chain restaurant cleans the window sills, light fixtures, and sugar containers every night?! Great specials and rewards program too.

The service was slow and not very accommodating. The food was below average and overpriced. It's just not that good, it's as simple as that. If you by chance find yourself craving a burger, you may be better off paying Burger King a visit than coming here.

Had the pretzel bites as an appetizer,came with cheese dip which was good. Got the whiskey river bbq burger for dinner. Burger was done just the way I like it. Service was good and the prices are reasonable. I would definitely go back in the future.

My husband I went stopped there for dinner and we will never go back.  It took 20 minutes to get our burgers and mine came with literally 6 fries.  I asked the waitress about it and she said they are cooking more and will bring them out when ready.  My husband finished his fries and asked for more. My additional fries came AFTER I finished my burger and 6 original fries.  Our waitress didn't appear for awhile so we asked another waitress to please get our waitress.  Well 15 minutes later she appeared and my husband asked about his fries and she "forgot". We said forget it and just give us our check because we are leaving.  Besides this, our burgers were dry and forget about asking for more bbq sauce because you will never get it.   We haven't been in awhile and noticed they changed the fry serving.  Unlimited but good luck getting another serving.  We will never go there again and will make sure we let our friends know of our experience.

If you ever have the opportunity to visit this Roseville Red Robin, Server Sarah is a must request. Sarah is a fantastic server! Hit her up! Also,  the food was perfect all around. They have a lot of new gourmet burgers. There's something for everyone.

My husband and I really enjoyed the food. The server was very nice and kept up on our refills. The food was cooked perfect. We both had burgers and I couldn't have been happier. The appetizer lacked a little. We had the chips with a ranch type of dip. They don't give you enough chips we had to ask for more. But overall it was a good time. The atmosphere was nice.

We actually had a good experience one Saturday afternoon at Red Robin.  Our server Catherine was mostly the reason why.  She was so wonderful with a table that contained three children, talking to each one of them, she was very engaging.  Our food wasn't too shabby either.  After my last experience at another Red Robin location, I wasn't exactly looking forward to stopping in, but I was pleasantly surprised.

I gave 1 star for the quality of burgers, and 1 star for the service. Overall, the level of cleanliness is what does this place in. It's dim lighting and dirty floor/booths/bathrooms/etc are a pairing for bad 70's sitcom. Slow bar service to boot. If I didn't have a 5 yr old, I certainly wouldn't come.

Normally this location looks very busy but Friday it was not too busy. While we were out shopping on New Years Day we decided to stop for lunch.  I have not had Red Robin in years... We thought about getting a carry out then decided to go in and sit down for lunch.  We were greeted by the hostess who was very friendly, we sat a booth in the bar area.  Our server, Tiffany? was attentive, nice, she was not rushing us, gave us a while to look over the menu and decide on which fattening burger we were going to order. She was an all around great server- The food came in a timely manner, and it was good.  Burgers were cooked how we liked and it ended up to be a good lunch stop for a change. I wouldn't say it was the best burger I've had but it was not the worst. LOL  Nice stop for lunch.

Good, reliable, consistent Red Robin location. The area where it's located is kind of bombed out (as is most of Gratiot on this stretch), so this is kind of an oasis of good sit-down food in this part of town. The Smoke & Pepper burger I had tasted good and was done to my specifications. Their sweet potato fries were actually pretty good. As every single chain seeks to add them to their menus, I've had more than my fair share of bad ones, but Red Robin (or at least this Red Robin) does it right. Good atmosphere, and really attentive and friendly service. If you're after a decent meal in Roseville, this is one of the places I'd suggest you head to.

Went here on a Sunday night at about 840pm. Was promptly greeted and seated. Young lady came over right away and took our drink order then the waitress came by and took our food order. Took forever for our appetizer, seems like she forgot, but she apologized and brought it out. Food was excellent and service was fine.
Went there a dozens times and never ever can get a hot burger cheese is always cold fries r getting worse just terrible
Sign up for their reward program for offers. Expect a wait on the weekend for seating.

I usually like this restaurant but my visit today (5/12/16) was the most unpleasant so far. Our waitress Rachel did just a bad job. She seemed irritated to be helping us and didn't make eye contact. We accidentally spilled our extra amount of milkshake which is admittedly our fault, but she didn't help us clean it up and didn't offer to replace it. Her attitude was most off putting and she just made our visit a bad one. She just didn't do a good job.

This place was disgusting. for a burger joint the flat, frozen dry hamburger patties that came on our burgers was a disgrace, the fries were soggy, and the fish and chips I'm pretty sure were freezer burned. It's been so long since I've gone to a Red Robins and the new décor sucks, what happened to the funky, fun decorations and the delicious burgers???? That's money and time ill never get back! So sad.

Haven't been back in about 10 months because of the last time we were here and received burnt crappy burgers and cold fries in our to go order. I had a free birthday burger so we deiced to try it again. Yep same crappy burger patties I think they changed the beef patties that they use now they are flat frozen patties. Just not the same as a few years ago. Our waitress was also trying to be a stand up comedian Didn't enjoy it. Wont be back. definitely would go somewhere else local to spend $12 on a burger

Once upon a time, Red Robin was the destination for excellent burgers and a great atmosphere. That was 10 years ago. Now? Prices are through the roof. $11-$15 for a burger? Not unless Kate Upton serves it in a bikini. The food is good, but they're no longer GREAT, and when I'm paying over $10 a burgers good isn't good enough. The fun atmosphere with unique decorations at every restaurant have been wiped away and given a glossy, homogenized  corporate makeover where every restaurant looks the same. And the service at this particular restaurant is best described as "put upon". Last few times, the servers have been inattentive, slow, and looking more annoyed to be there than anything. Doesn't matter if it's the dinner hour on a Saturday or a Thursday evening, they act like every shift is a slog. It's a shame, this place was once a destination for my family. Now, the service is frustrating, the food is hardly desirable, and they have almost priced themselves out of my family's budget.

I feel bad for the wait staff at this restaurant because the way it is organized is for failure.  We waited forever to be seated, then waited forever to get our food.  They made the wrong sandwich for me, then brought out the correct one.  My first bite - a PIECE OF METAL!  The manager, to his credit, apologized, but had no explanation for it.  My burger was not cooked as I had requested (significantly undercooked).  The wait staff deserves an award for handling the chaos that they are unable to control   Food was OK.  Will not return.

If i could give this place negative stars i would. Was going here with my girlfriend every saturday for a while and had a great experience everytime til a few weeks ago. I knew it was gonna be a bad experience when it was ten minutes for our waitress to come get our drink order. Finally get our drinks and one has stuff floating in it. The week before we ordered fried pickles and loved them a basket full of fried pickles whats not to love. Well this time we ordered them again to get a basket of fries with a few pickles on top. Why would i pay for that when i get fries with my burger? When we finally get our burgers we had to take the slimy black spotted lettuce off to eat them. I emailed online and sent them pictures of my problems i had and was told i would hear back from the franchise within 48 hours and i have heard from no one not even a response from there corporate office. You can remodel a building but it wont make crappy food any better. Id rather spend my money at bagger daves and get quality food

My daughter  and  I  stopped  in for a quick lunch and were pleasantly  surprised  by the  improvements  here.   I'm a vegetarian and found many items on the menu I could order. I had a blue cheese salad and fried broccoli. The broccoli was lightly battered and cooked through, not crunchy and wet inside like so often happens. This is not snobby health food by any means but fresh and well prepared is much better than I usually get from chain restaurants.   The service was good and the restaurant  is  perfectly clean.
Service sucked food was made wrong.... Wait staff came to take order and give bill.  Paid $4.00 for drink asked for a refill and never got...

I was there a few weeks ago and can definitely see that this place has gone down hill. I ordered a salad off the menu and it had all of the ingredients listed. I got my salad and it had corn on it (which I'm allergic to). No where on the menu did it say there was corn on it. I pushed all 30 pieces of corn aside and went for it. 4 bites in and I realized the chicken was rubbery, pink and definitely raw! You give me raw chicken, I give you 1 star. GROSS!

Visited this Roseville Red Robin for the first time on August 9, 2016.  I took my niece out to dinner that day.  She had been there before, but I never ate at a Red Robin until that day.  My niece ordered onion rings for us - absolutely delicious!  I ordered what she did for our entrée, which was the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap - again delicious!  Tons of chicken on this sandwich.  For dessert, we ordered the donuts, aka - Towering Doh! Rings.  Sounds simple, but dipped in hot fudge and fresh homemade strawberry sauce, another delicious dish!  Our waitress was soooo nice, which is quite refreshing, since I've had some duds at other places.  All in all, I cannot complain and I am sure that I will return again.  Only down side was the prices.  The sandwich was competitive in price, but the onion rings and donuts, I thought, were quite pricey.

For years I refused to eat at a Red Robin after having worked there in college. The nightmares of "smiling" burgers haunted my dreams for years. But many years have past and Red Robin has stepped up their game. Most notably they have done a nice job of supporting individuals with dietary restrictions. I am a fan again because they have gluten free options include buns for burgers and a dedicated fryer for fries. Nice job RR! We had a large group with 3 individuals with celiacs and one vegetarian and our server did a great job of pointing out safe options for everyone and got all of our orders correct. She was attentive and made sure our drinks were full and everyone was happy. Overall this was a pleasant experience for me consider I tend to steer clear of chain restaurants these days.

Absolutely thee worst meal I've had in a long, long, LONG time and if I could give you ZERO stars I definitely would!! Let me start by saying that I haven't eaten red robins in almost 10 years and the experience left me never wanting to return. I ordered a BBQ burger from the gourmet menu to the tune of 13.99 because it claimed it came with candied bacon and all the fixings. My bun was not toasted, the bacon was cheap, thin and disgusting but overall the burger was decent.  The fries though...I ordered had garlic herb  fries and they came to the table cold, heavily filled with grease  and a few sprinkles of parm that couldn't even melt because the fried were so cold. I then ordered regular fries and when they arrived they were STILL cold. Smh!!! Who wants to eat cold French fries?? Ruined my entire meal! I will never EVER return and I wish I would have just waited u til Texas Roadhouse opened up. If I was going to spend 15 dollars on a meal I could've had a GOOD steak!

This is by far the dirtiest place to eat. Bugs flying, dirty cups, dirty silverware, just filth. Went here with my family and now we all have food poisoning. My baby son is catching it the worse and all he had was half of a kiddy shake. The manager is not properly training the staff. I saw numerous of health violations while sitting in the dinning area. From the dishwasher carrying an open bucket of ice all through the restaurant with customers with no lid, to changing the garbage, to grabbing clean glasses all with the same gloves on. This place is a disaster waiting to happen. I will never eat hers again. The sanitation here is horrid and I wish here in Michigan these culinary employees from management on down would have more passion for food handling instead of trying to make a quick buck.

We were here on 12/21/16 in the evening.  The service was awful.  We waited for a server for 20 minutes to visit our table.  We placed an appetizer and drink order.  The appetizer came but not the drinks.   Another 20 minutes passed and we had to flag the server down for drinks.  We were told they were very busy.  Finally drinks came and our order was taken.  We ordered two burgers which came out in a timely manner after our order was taken. One of the burgers was not right. It was supposed to be a burger with an egg on top in the jalapeños on the side. The jalapeños were on top of the hamburger and there was no egg. Again we had to wait till the correct order came out. The service here was less then perfect.

I really cannot understand how this restaurant has so many bad reviews! My wife and I had a very enjoyable experience eating there tonight. The food was awesome and our waitress,Jenna,was very polite and attentive. We will be going here again!!

Very disappointing burgers, wimpy toppings, bad buns, very greasy and old fries. The only decent thing was the beer. Service wasn't good either, she only came to ask if everything was okay once we were done eating, and never refilled our waters. I'm normally easy going but will never come back to Red Robin again, especially not this location.

Not sure what happen here but dam. A McDonald's hamburger is almost better cooked then this stuff and I don't even eat McDonald's crap. The cheese looked like it was plastic I took half it off, the lettuce looked bad so that went. The hamburger just was not that great for the 20+ dollar bill. The only thing good were the onion rings and the fires my wife had. The service for take out was not bad but the food is left lacking. Don't think I will be spending the extra cash on a Red Robin's "Gourmet Burgers" any time soon. *update* the following day after having this food I am very sick and have been throwing up. If you love yourself don't eat here. Well a case was open for this issue I posted however even the HQ of this company can't reply to email or cases in a timely manner.  Honestly it's best to stay away from this place all together. They only care about sales and nothing more.
First time back here in a while My daughter and I are having lunch and the staff is very friendly and wow the food came up FAST  Everything was cooked perfect  The waitress Shawna was great

I visited this location yesterday and had an amazing experience I had to share. Pamela was our waitress and she was a breath of fresh air with her impeccable customer service and pleasantness as our waitress. She was extremely attentive, friendly and made sure we had everything we could possibly need. The food was delicious and I had a great time. I will definitely be back to this location again and highly recommend to others.

The best burgers I have ever tasted, and I thought no one could outdo my husband.  This was my first time going to Red Robin and I say hats off to the chef!  My favorite place to eat in town.  Thanks!

We started coming to this one versus the Clinton township one because the food seemed better but the last two or three times we have come it's not good.  Burgers are cold, missing ingredients, plates are dirty.  Our waiter Andrew was very nice but couldn't get it together.  We had to keep requesting stuff, like silverware.  Guess we will go back to CT and see how that goes.

Worst service I've experienced. Also, wasn't aware this turned into a Chuck E. Cheese. So many crying children and parents who let them scream. Would not return. Food was good, but really skimped on the fries. Just meh.

I have visited this location a food time.  Our waiter James, who goes by Jim spitted in our baby's food. The rest of the food he didn't spit in was really good. My son order a royal Red Robin (the one with the egg on top) after taking his first bite, he quickly spitted it out.  After lifting the bread from the top of the sandwich, you could clearing see the luge. I was angry, I wanted to attack  Jim, but since we don't live in that era. I am force to write on yelp. Please take warm to James who goes by Jim. Just adding an update, my son is sick. Food poisoning, my wife had to return to make an official comment about this to the management at Red Robin. The general manager said "he didn't see him do anything on camera", but  I know what was on the burger.

I usually love Red Robin but, this location has the worst service. I waitress never stopped to check on us or get a refill until we were completely done with our meal and another person removed our plates. I had to ask 3 times for my bill and it took nearly 20 minutes to get it. She was too busy chatting with another table then pay attention to her other guests.

I just left this Red Robin.  The service was horrible.  The waitress came to our table and didn't say her name.  I ordered soup and it was never put in.  She did not apologize nor did she offer to put the soup in.  I asked for mustard and after waiting so long, I had to ask another waitress.  We asked for more fries, she brought out one basket and they broken and some were soggy.  Clearly she was having a bad which was unfortunate because we had to pay for this bad service.  Luckily for her, we still left a tip.

Dry croissant roll and stopped brewing coffee because it was ''too late'' after serving the first cup. Other than that, the service was fantastic! I got a spinach wrap and the French onion soup.. it was SO good. They have vegetarian & vegan options. Definitely try the purple lemonade. The waitress was really quick and super sweet. :)

Absolutely filthy restaurant. As we were being seated at a large round table we mentioned to the hostess that there was food and napkins all over the floor around the table. She said "oh well we will just go to the next table" figuring she would send someone to clean it. No she just ended up seating the next customers there. Gross!  Our waitress Rachelle was not very good either. The food took forever ( thinking she didn't send the order in right away because the people next to us came much later and were almost done eating by the time we got our food) and she kept reaching in front of our faces when she didn't need to. So rude.  Overall not a good experience. They sorely need some management to whip them into shape. Clean this pigpen up!

This is actually one of my favorite restaurants. Their variety of gourmet burgers is what does it for me. The service is as average as one would expect. Only downfall is the long waiting time to be seated which really speaks well on how many others enjoy this location!

Service has declined since I last came here.  My daughter wanted burgers after our play date. We spent over an hour here and I didn't get a single refill on my strawberry lemonade (no alcohol) which cost $4.99. I would have been better off ordering a beer.  The fries were undercooked with my tavern burger. For a place that raves about their fries, you would think they would do a better job. The burger was a bit dry too.  The kiddie meatball meal was served with all broken breadsticks for skewers, to make it seem like a lot more. She got 6 mandarins slices as a side, with another six as a refill. I know an individual serving cup is more than 12 slices.  The whole experience was very disappointing.
Like this location. Usually there isn't a wait but if there is, it's not super long. Servers are good with interaction and taking care of the customer.

I'm not one to give out one-star reviews, but this place deserves it. I will never eat at a Red Robin again. Ever. Overpriced, mediocre food, and a slow/incompetent waitress made this a total waste of time and money. The waitress brought my son the wrong shake, then forgot his refill. Never brought the ice waters that I asked for. Told us "our fries are all seasoned fries" (no, they are not), and basically forgot we existed after the food was delivered. Never brought us silverware, either. I tipped her less than 10%, when she deserved nothing.  The food.. Ok, the fried pickles were good, but the portion was very small. The burger I had was absolutely NOT worth $15! It was small, greasy, and frankly, turned my stomach. I've had better burgers at Sonic. Do yourself a favor.. Go anywhere else.

Three of us just left after having dinner at this Red Robin and it was a less than pleasant experience. We ordered three different entrees and only one of them was served the way ordered. We ordered the Banzai wings which are supposed to come with pineapple, but there was no pineapple on my order. My son ordered a burger with no mayo, yet the burger came with mayo on the TOP and BOTTOM bun! We could not send the items back because we never saw our server again until we were almost finished with our meal. We were never offered refills on our water NOR did we receive even a hint of an apology for our food coming out incorrectly. Bottomless fries?? I guess only if you have a waitress that is attentive enough to ask!! Our fries tasted like they were from the bottom of the batch anyway so they weren't very good. Her response to the mayo on the burger was "Oh really"? and she said "sometimes they put pineapple on top of the wings and sometimes they don't"! So I guess what the menu states as a description on an item doesn't really mean anything?! When I asked for the name of the manager on the way out, the three hostesses really didn't seem to be too concerned either when I told them we were not pleased with our experience. Needless to say, we will not be back!

One star for service maybe 3 for food. Took the fam, ordered apps, soup and food. Two beers, no silverware, no napkins, had to ask for both, bottomless fries, sure if you can find your waitress. No manager present. Empty glasses my kids were thirsty, it wasn't overly crowded, about normal for a Saturday early dinner rush, waited with empty glasses for at least 10 min to even get our bill. Was absolutely he worst dining experience ever. This is why we don't spend our hard earned money on craptastick service. I am an able bodied person and can cook just as good as any of the "chefs" they have on hand. And don't need to go out to eat. But I can't cook every day. We paid our bill and left. Won't be back. Had similar service about a month back. Thought we would try again. Disappointed. So many better options to get my disposable income...
